content.question: One end of a string is attached to a vertical pole with the other end of the string attached to a ball that swings in a horizontal circular path, as shown. Which of the following free body diagrams represents the forces exerted on the ball?

choices.label: The figure presents a force diagram, and consists of two arrows of equal length extending from a point. The first arrow points to the left. The second arrow points vertically downward.

The figure presents a force diagram, and consists of two arrows extending from a point. The first arrow points upward and to the left. The second arrow is slightly shorter than the first arrow and points vertically downward.
The figure presents a force diagram, and consists of three arrows extending from a point. The first arrow points upward. The second arrow points to the left. The third arrow points downward.

The figure presents a force diagram, and consists of three arrows of differing lengths extending from a point. The first arrow is the longest and extends upward and to the right. The second arrow is the shortest and points vertically upward. The third arrow points vertically downward.

content.answer: The figure presents a force diagram, and consists of two arrows extending from a point. The first arrow points upward and to the left. The second arrow is slightly shorter than the first arrow and points vertically downward.
